content:
First, I am not a mac user. Some suggestions: - you can install a new copy of the same version of thunderbird directly over the top of current install. You can locate and download the desired version and language here: https://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/thunderbird/releases/ - if you want to save your data for a move to new computer, you need a copy of the profile folder. Here are possible steps:

  1. click help>troubleshootinginformation
  2. scroll to 'profile folder' and click 'open folder
  3. exit thunderbird here. important
  4. you are now in the profile, back up at least one folder so that you can do a full copy of the profile.
  5. on new PC, in thunderbird, click tools>impoort.>import from another thunderbird installation
creator: davidsk

content: Can you post a screenshot of the imapmail folder in your profile? and one of the profile itself? and one of the Mail folder, and also the Mail\Local folders folder? Seeing all of those would let people here see what you're experiencing. Also, one of the main screen so we see how the folders appear in thunderbird.
creator: davidsk

content: It may help if you provide more specifics. Sharing suggestions you have already followed may also be useful. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content: click view>folders>folder pane header and those options should appear on menu
creator: davidsk

content: Only xfinity can help you restore your passwords. Thunderbird is an agent that can retain your password, but only after you provide it.
creator: davidsk
